name: Financial Institution Business Capabilities
description: Example business capability architecture for a financial institution showing top-level and sub-capabilities

nodes.name: Risk Management
nodes.description: Ability to identify, assess, monitor, and mitigate various types of financial and operational risks across the organization to protect assets and ensure regulatory compliance.

nodes.name: Credit Risk Management
nodes.description: Ability to evaluate and manage the risk of loss from borrower default or failure to meet contractual obligations, including credit scoring, limit management, and exposure monitoring.

nodes.name: Market Risk Management
nodes.description: Ability to identify, measure, and control potential losses from adverse movements in market prices, interest rates, foreign exchange rates, and commodity prices.

nodes.name: Customer Relationship Management
nodes.description: Ability to acquire, retain, and grow customer relationships through personalized service, product offerings, and engagement strategies that drive customer satisfaction and lifetime value.

nodes.name: Customer Onboarding
nodes.description: Ability to acquire new customers through KYC verification, account opening, identity validation, and regulatory compliance checks while delivering a seamless digital or branch experience.

nodes.name: Customer Service and Support
nodes.description: Ability to provide responsive multi-channel customer assistance, resolve inquiries and complaints, and maintain service quality across digital, phone, and in-person interactions.

nodes.name: Payments Processing
nodes.description: Ability to execute, clear, and settle various payment types including wire transfers, ACH, card transactions, and real-time payments while ensuring security, compliance, and operational efficiency.

nodes.name: Domestic Payments
nodes.description: Ability to process and settle payments within a single country using local payment rails, clearing systems, and regulatory frameworks including ACH, checks, and domestic wires.

nodes.name: International Payments
nodes.description: Ability to execute cross-border payments through SWIFT, correspondent banking networks, and foreign exchange services while managing currency conversion, regulatory compliance, and settlement timing.

nodes.name: Lending Operations
nodes.description: Ability to originate, underwrite, service, and manage various loan products including mortgages, personal loans, and commercial credit while ensuring credit quality and regulatory compliance.

nodes.name: Loan Origination
nodes.description: Ability to process loan applications from initial inquiry through approval, including credit assessment, document collection, underwriting decisions, and loan booking.

nodes.name: Loan Servicing
nodes.description: Ability to manage ongoing loan administration including payment processing, account maintenance, escrow management, customer communications, and delinquency management throughout the loan lifecycle.

relationships.description: Credit Risk Management is a sub-capability of Risk Management
Market Risk Management is a sub-capability of Risk Management
Customer Onboarding is a sub-capability of Customer Relationship Management
Customer Service and Support is a sub-capability of Customer Relationship Management
Domestic Payments is a sub-capability of Payments Processing
International Payments is a sub-capability of Payments Processing
Loan Origination is a sub-capability of Lending Operations
Loan Servicing is a sub-capability of Lending Operations
